intro: Leptonychia tessmannii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique flowering habit and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
